attributes.magic: PE32+ executable (GUI) x86-64 Mono/.Net assembly, for MS Windows

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This signature identifies Adobe Extensible Metadata Platform (XMP) identifiers embedded within files. Defined as a standard for mapping graphical asset relationships, XMP allows for tracking of both parent-child relationships and individual revisions. There are three categories of identifiers: original document, document, and instance. Generally, XMP data is stored in XML format, updated on save/copy, and embedded within the graphical asset. These identifiers can be used to track both malicious and benign graphics within common Microsoft and Adobe document lures.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects WEDGECUT a reconnaissance tool to checks hosts are online using ICMP packets
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: ditekSHen

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert icmp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Unusual PING detected"; icode:0; itype:8; fragbits:!M; content:!"ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWABCDEFGHI",depth 32; content:!"0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuv",depth 32; content:!"EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE",depth 36; content:!"WANG2"; content:!"cacti-monitoring-system",depth 65; content:!"SolarWinds",depth 72; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop,ruleset community; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-closer-look-at-the-target-malware-part-ii/; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-first-look-at-the-target-intrusion-malware/; classtype:successful-recon-limited; sid:29456; rev:3; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PING Windows"; itype:8; content:"abcdefghijklmnop",depth 16; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:382; rev:11; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PING"; icode:0; itype:8; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:384; rev:8; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Echo Reply"; icode:0; itype:0; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:408; rev:8; )

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Cmd.EXE Missing Space Characters Execution Anomaly
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects Windows command lines that miss a space before or after the /c flag when running a command using the cmd.exe.
This could be a sign of obfuscation of a fat finger problem (typo by the developer).

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp\kmsauto.cmd /kms; Image=C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp\kmsauto.cmd; EventID=1}
@{CommandLine=C:\Users\user\AppData\Local\Temp\kmsauto.cmd /kms; Image=C:\Users\user\AppData\Local\Temp\kmsauto.cmd; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Script Execution From Temp Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious script executions from temporary folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems), Tim Shelton

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=04029E121A0CFA5991749937DD22A1D9,SHA256=9F914D42706FE215501044ACD85A32D58AAEF1419D404FDDFA5D3B48F66CCD9F,IMPHASH=7C955A0ABC747F57CCC4324480737EF7; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\KMSMatrix.7.2.exe" ; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" & \"C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\s_w.ps1\"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\KMSMatrix.7.2.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\KMSMatrix.7.2.exe"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" & \"C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\s_w.ps1\"; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\KMSMatrix.7.2.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}
@{CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" & \"%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Temp\s_w.ps1\"; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Set Suspicious Files as System Files Using Attrib.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the usage of attrib with the "+s" option to set scripts or executables located in suspicious locations as system files to hide them from users and make them unable to be deleted with simple rights. The rule limits the search to specific extensions and directories to avoid FPs

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=A5FF3845B0F55157C4AEA35E9EAE213560ACDB5C,MD5=A243BC9DB0BFB5F22E146B88BB10C58F,SHA256=0758152947F1A550E52CE8E3F9BCD988A23D36A458AD953795769B11C38FF2EA,IMPHASH=2CB38FE7D8F223D9DA50B7CBA9B95A6D; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=ATTRIB.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Attribute Utility; FileVersion=10.0.22621.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe /c ""C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\inf.cmd" "; CommandLine=attrib  +h +s "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\s_w.ps1"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\attrib.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=SHA1=A5FF3845B0F55157C4AEA35E9EAE213560ACDB5C,MD5=A243BC9DB0BFB5F22E146B88BB10C58F,SHA256=0758152947F1A550E52CE8E3F9BCD988A23D36A458AD953795769B11C38FF2EA,IMPHASH=2CB38FE7D8F223D9DA50B7CBA9B95A6D; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=ATTRIB.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Attribute Utility; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe /c ""C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\inf.cmd" "; CommandLine=attrib  +h +s "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\office.exe"; FileVersion=10.0.22621.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\attrib.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\KMSMatrix.7.2.exe"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" & Set-ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted -Force; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\KMSMatrix.7.2.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}
@{CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" & Set-ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted -Force; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=1}
@{CommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe & Set-ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted -Force; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=1}
@{CommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" & Set-ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted -Force; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Read Contents From Stdin Via Cmd.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detect the use of "<" to read and potentially execute a file via cmd.exe

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe /S /D /c echo C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp\kmsauto.cmd; Image=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious DNS Query for IP Lookup Service APIs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects DNS queries for IP lookup services such as "api.ipify.org" originating from a non browser process.

match_context.values: @{query=ipinfo.io}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changes to the PowerShell execution policy in order to bypass signing requirements for script execution

match_context.values: @{Details=Unrestricted; EventType=SetValue; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\PowerShell\1\ShellIds\Microsoft.PowerShell\ExecutionPolicy}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level - PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "Set-ExecutionPolicy" cmdlet.

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=& Set-ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted -Force; Path=; ScriptBlockId=277efd92-f903-4b52-8a24-df6daeb40266; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}
@{ScriptBlockText=& Set-ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted -Force; Path=; ScriptBlockId=8a472c79-8b8e-44c1-827f-f213e6e77f0d; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

match_context.values:
@{ScriptBlockText=Set-Location -Path "$env:windir\System32"
$command = "cscript.exe slmgr.vbs /dli > $env:tmp\o_WStatus.txt"
Invoke-Expression $command
$Text3 = Get-Content -Path "$env:tmp\o_WStatus.txt" -raw
$TargetLanguage = "en"
$Uri = "https://translate.googleapis.com/translate_a/single?client=gtx&sl=auto&tl=$($TargetLanguage)&dt=t&q=$Text3"
$Response = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $Uri -Method Get
$Response[0].SyncRoot | foreach { $_[0] } > "$env:tmp\WStatus00.log"
$Translation = Get-Content -Path "$env:tm [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=fcc5a53f-9d87-4700-9461-84ea39010674; Path=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\s_w.ps1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=Set-Location -Path "$env:windir\System32"
$command = "cscript.exe slmgr.vbs /dli > $env:tmp\o_WStatus.txt"
Invoke-Expression $command
$Text3 = Get-Content -Path "$env:tmp\o_WStatus.txt" -raw
$TargetLanguage = "en"
$Uri = "https://translate.googleapis.com/translate_a/single?client=gtx&sl=auto&tl=$($TargetLanguage)&dt=t&q=$Text3"
$Response = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $Uri -Method Get
$Response[0].SyncRoot | foreach { $_[0] } > "$env:tmp\WStatus00.log"
$Translation = Get-Content -Path "$env:tm [TRUNCATED]; Path=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\s_w.ps1; ScriptBlockId=d1de6145-7764-48e4-ada3-81dab6a86109; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of the "PSScriptPolicyTest" PowerShell script by an uncommon process. This file is usually generated by Microsoft Powershell to test against Applocker.

match_context.values: @{TargetFilename=%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Temp\__PSScriptPolicyTest_jreobhth.yxr.ps1}
@{TargetFilename=%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Temp\__PSScriptPolicyTest_0rmfgcdm.q3o.psm1}
@{TargetFilename=%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Temp\__PSScriptPolicyTest_c0nycesj.veo.ps1}
@{TargetFilename=%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Temp\__PSScriptPolicyTest_pvon5aqn.lqw.psm1}
